title: Trainspotting
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: — Naw, Durie wis transferred ages ago, Spud.

title: The works of Robert Louis Stevenson;
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Never a word said Miss Alison ; no doubt she thought the more ; no doubt her pride was stung, for she was a bonebred Durie ; and no doubt her heart was touched to see her cousin so unjustly used.

title: [Works]
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Never a word said Miss Alison ; no doubt she thought the more ; no doubt her pride was stung, for she was a bone-bred Durie ; and no doubt her heart was touched to see her cousin so unjustly used.

title: The Stickit minister's wooing,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: " What has been the matter with me, Durie ? " said Gilbert, though in his heart he knew.

title: Traditions of Edinburgh.
author: Chambers, Robert
snippet: Dr M'Crie, in his Life of John Knox, states that the Reformer, on commencing duty in Edinburgh at the conclusion  of the strug-g'les with the queen-regent, ' lodged in the house of David Forrest, a burgess of Edinburgh, from which he removed to the lodging which had belonged to Durie, abbot of Dunfermline.'

title: Traditions of Edinburgh.
author: Chambers, Robert
snippet: The story of the abduction of Gibson of Durie by Christie's Will, and his immurement in a border tower for some weeks, that his voice might be absent in the decision of a case — as given in the Border Minstrelsy by Scott — is only incorrect in some particulars.
